attributes.additional_details:
Ban speed humps

Responsible department: Department for Transport


Speed humps are physically dangerous and morally indefensible..
PHYSICALLY DANGEROUS They cause drivers and passengers back problems and exarcebate chronic illnesses such as as osteoporosis. They also cause vehicle deterioration and exhaust problems which can cause increased pollution and damage to the environment.

MORALLY INDEFENSIBLE
Citizens should be advised through traffic signs that there are specific speed restrictions or that they are driving too fast and should be penalised through the courts for doing so.

Ban them
